definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Heir to an industrial past, the region has turned towards tourism.
sentences.chinese: 曾经工业的继承者，而如今这里已转向旅游业。

sentences.english: The Revolution, whose heirs we are, ought to be intelligent on all points.
sentences.chinese: 革命应当全面了解，而我们正是革命事业的继承者。

sentences.english: Taoist ritual is actually a successor civilization.
sentences.chinese: 道教实际上是礼乐文明的继承者。

sentences.english: Security-critical code requires both callers and inheritors to be fully trusted.
sentences.chinese: 安全关键代码要求调用方和继承者都完全受信任。

sentences.english: Han Zhen is an important successor and disseminator of nature view of Taizhou school.
sentences.chinese: 韩贞是泰州学派崇尚自然思想的重要继承者和传播者。

sentences.english: And heavenly music was sounded in the sky, out of reverence for the successor of the Buddhas of old.
sentences.chinese: 天空响着天乐，出于对佛的继承者的尊重。

sentences.english: The researchers looked at a sample of 302 people who had inherited a house.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们关注着被抽选出来的的302位房屋继承者。

sentences.english: This Agreement will inure to the benefit of my successors and permitted assigns .
sentences.chinese: 这个合约将对我继承者的利益适用并允许转让。

sentences.english: To be what your father wants, is to be the heir of his throne.
sentences.chinese: 按你父皇的心愿行事，就会成为继承者。

sentences.english: This Agreement will be binding upon each party's respective permitted successors and assigns.
sentences.chinese: 本协议对任一方准许的继承者和受让者有约束力。

sentences.english: The citizen holding the software copyright dies without a legal heir.
sentences.chinese: 拥有该软件著作权的公民死亡而无合法继承者。

sentences.english: The PNG (Portable Network Graphics) file format was created as the free, open-source successor to the GIF.
sentences.chinese: PNG文件格式可以作为GIF的自由开源的继承者。

sentences.english: And heavenly songs came wafted from the skies, out of reverence for the successor of the Buddhas of old!
sentences.chinese: 天上天乐鸣空，出于对佛的继承者的尊重。

sentences.english: Russia is usually considered the Soviet Union"s successor state in diplomatic matters.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯在外交事宜中通常被看作是苏联的继承者。

sentences.english: It's hard to find a successor to someone like him.
sentences.chinese: 找到一个像他一样的继承者实在很难。

definition: to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
Zhengtong Emperor, reign name of sixth Ming Emperor Zhu Qizhen 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
royal family/imperial household/member of the royal family
direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
